Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Assistance begins with the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh sons, I have given you this book, which is the last in the science of medicine, and that is due to my completion with it the final chapter, and for the exposures of it, and for its declarations, I think that you will understand this by your love for me, and this treatise, which is part of surgical art.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	How the surgery is placed in our region and in our time, with only some private notes, but heavy danger in the science of it, and its sight is hidden; and not remaining in it except some small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which have changed most, and invented for those errors and hesitations, within their closed views, and has prolonged the force of it and the art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria. Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The translation is: 
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	It appears to be saying that Hippocrates had a name but it is mentioned more in his work than in the art of medicine.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said of him in the introduction to this book; because whoever does not know this is not acquainted with anatomy, and will therefore fall into error by which many men are killed, as I myself have seen many of those who were corrupted by this knowledge and threw themselves away from that science and their experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	And I saw a doctor foolish and inexperienced who induced an scrophulous apoplexy in the neck of a woman, and cut some arteries in the neck so that great blood flowed into her, and she died among the others.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who prescribed that the patient swallow a large stone from a man in whom it had been formed, and came to him and cut open that stone at one end, so that that man died on the fourth day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I myself called out that he should extract it, and I saw that because of the size of the stone and the disposition of the patient, he would necessarily die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	There is another doctor who received a stipend from a duke of our land for surgery, and came to a patient with a black cast that was due to a fracture in the cavity; and because he had his ignorance, he extracted the fracture, on the wound, with pillows and needles with strong tension, and did not secure the breathing of the plague.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And he took him off according to his wishes, and put on the bandages, and placed the liniment for a few days and commanded that we untie the ligament; and thus until the cavity and the foot were opened up, and brought about loss.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and he prepared himself to untie the ligament, and succeeded in restoring his tranquility and causing an end to his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But meanwhile the corruption had already been confirmed in the limb, so that it could not be restrained, and did not cease to roam through the limb until the disease was severe.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who perforated an infected gangrene, and had it ulcerated after several days, until the wound became magnified with the malice of him on the lord of him.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause of the gout is that the gall caust is pure melancholy humors, and it does not penetrate into the body through iron, but rather affects a member which suffered damage.

I have already existed in this entire book where it was demonstrated that opposition to operation is based on error and fear; therefore it is necessary for you to guard this truth and set it aside, so that the people do not go astray through speaking about it and deceiving you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take up your arms for solicitation and protection of God, and your patients with fortitude and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz. De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	The translation of the given line is:
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	The text means: At that point begins the treatment of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Explain the quality of the juice of that cautery and the signs of its use, and in which compartment it is prohibited to use cautery.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	So it is said that the discourse on the quality of the juice of cautery and its signs is long and complicated, subtle for knowledge, and hidden; and already many sages have spoken about it, and there are also disagreements among them, and I can recall a small part of their discourses, which warn against delay.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And so it is said that cautery cures all the universal part of the body, where there is matter or its matter, except for two places, which are colds; their matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the cold and dry place where there is matter, it dries up; for some say that cautery is suitable for this, and others disagree with him, that cautery is not convenient in a disease of which quality and dryness are the cause, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and therefore it is inconvenient that a cold and dry disease should be healed by a hot and moist one.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	When cold humors cause inflammation in the joints and infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	I have already experienced this in some cases to discover.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However I do not know how it will come upon this that which was already experienced in some cases to discover, particularly after being experimented on and exercised at the capital of cautery, for having taken account of the diversity of the human body's complexity and the disposition of illnesses in their innermost parts, as well as their causes, accidents, and the space of time involved.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other complexities it is not a matter of fear, and mainly in cold and humid illnesses, where all the doctors have already agreed on those, and do not give different opinions on the application of cautery in those cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	You should know, sons, that the secret of healing by cautery is from the fire and its goodness, which is over cauterization in medicine, because the fire is simple, its action proceeds only to the member being cauterized and not to any other nearby members, without much damage.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	The medical treatment is causing more harm than good, and it's leading to a difficult recovery in the affected limb.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But the heat, due to its great power and substance, is causing nothing but excess. We are already aware of this through experimentation and long experience in studying the art, as well as the truth of the causes; and therefore I excuse myself from the length of the discourse, if not for the fact that it is not suitable for your free ears in this pause. If I were not to share with you a secret hidden among the heat, and the quality of its operation on the body, where you expel diseases through its expulsion, then it would be a philosophical demonstration proven, which would be more convenient for your pain.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And wise sons, know that the times differ from each other in which it is convenient to perform cautery and pause at the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	I say that cautery is convenient at all times, because the damage from time is submerged in the youth of this process that comes with the cautery, and especially when it's for painful or necessary pains, strong and intense ones, which do not allow delay, lest they be feared by those who bring malice, which is greater than minor harm entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	Joint pain caused by cold humors is considered a popular and foolish practice by doctors.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	The cause is not as simple because the needle causes changes to the complexion and dries out the humors that are causing pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	However, the cauterization is unnecessary over medicine due to the whim of its lord and virtue and greatness of his operation and size of his lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that his illness may return in a few hours of time, according to the nature of the disease and location of its manifestation, virtue of him, and because he is prepared inside the body with the addition of unnecessary things, and also with what is brought into him through food and similarity of those causes; but if the illness for which cauterization has been applied is a subtle one in a few members with little superfluity and humidity, then it is possible that the pain does not return to him, but rather he undergoes small ones.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	It seems to be saying that cautery is the last resort of medicine and it's also considered the most effective treatment, not because one understands its benefits in the matter, but because they believe it won't lead to further complications.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	The cause is in opposition to that; and the understanding is that cautery is the last resort of medicine not because one believes it has inherent benefits, but rather because other methods of treatment are ineffective for certain illnesses, so at the end of the process they administer cautery as a last resort.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And here it says that cautery is the last resort of medicine, not according to the understanding which understands the vulgar and foolish ways of doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	They said that cautery with iron is better than cautery with gold, not because of the equality of the two metals or the greatness of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	They said that the location of cautery doesn't matter, because it's not absolutely true, for you have already done this before and hit what you didn't aim at, so that it is better with iron than with gold in most cases; however, when you do cautery with gold, it's not your declaration, because it depends on the quantity of gold you use due to the roughness of the gold and the preparation needed to receive friction, and if you adjust over it from the start, the gold will burn out in the fire, and some thin sheets are added so that the craftsman can see what he's doing.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And from that point on, it is made to cauterize over iron needles because we must push them lightly and then more seriously in the correct position of operation.

And I have ordered this chapter on cauterization according to chapters, and I have placed those of the chapter inside the feet, so that the patient who wants relief from it may know.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On cauterization for pain in the head due to coldness and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization treats the coldness and humidity as a source of that most serious accident, which has two causes, namely, because of the formation of the humors (soda) and multiple traumatic fluxes, called corissa, affecting the head to the parts of the heels and ears, causing excessive sleeping, toothache, and gout, and universally all sorts of diseases caused by coldness, such as paralysis, soddeness, and apoplexy, resembling those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is as follows: first, to command the patient to be evacuated by laxative medicine on the head, for three or four nights, according to what the virtue of the disease requires and the age and custom of the person.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	Prepare the one who is to shave his head with a razor, and prepare that knife between your hands on a wooden bench and have him place his hands on his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	Have the one shaving his head pause the razor of your palm above the skin on his nose between his eyebrows.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, as you said from my previous warning, this area is sensitive, mark that location carefully, and apply olive wood cauterization fire, which is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	Have him pause over the sensitive location carefully, in a manner that descends, with which your hand is constricted little by little, and you rotate it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Lift your hand slightly and look at the location, and if you see already the bone is exposed some quantity of it, as much as the amount of grains of sand, then lift your hand, and if not turn your hand with that iron, with another one, until it's visible on the bone what you have told me.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	Apply a small amount of salt and dissolve it on the location, and let it sit for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Place your hand over the spot near the border, and let it rest on the entrance so that the scar of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Apply treatment to the affected area with the four medicines until health is restored.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	They also said that when the plague remains, it is better to apply a soft cushion under the arm, so that it is more comfortable and youthful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	They said that if you want to cure, the tendon should be cauterized into the bone, and the cautery kept inside until no part of the bone is affected.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And let it dry where it has been hardened by the bone, and cure it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	They said that if the cautery penetrates to the skin, so that it warms into the bone with great force and presses on the bone, this is the form of ulceration.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They consider that from that location, the vapors of the head will escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	Let it be kept open for a long time, and cure it until it becomes consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	The text means: "But as for me I have not seen these two kinds of cauteries of all, but in a few men by way of fear; and the softer one is my choice, it is better to cure him when he is, rather than after, because his head has been broken off by the solution of continuity from this cause, as they have testified in other members, and especially when the patient's head is of frosty nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The text means: "And the first kind of cautery is more saved and better for me; and from that, I have heard and know this cure is good.

E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	Apopia the wound with a pointed cautery, apply two stitches on each side of the forehead, under the eyebrows, and hold back those hairs a little.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	Watch out that you do not burn it.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And with the pointed cautery, this is how to do it.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the cautery of softening of eyelids, eyelashes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by disease or by humidity, then apply that eyelid with a cautery and one cautery on top of it; and this is how to do it:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you apply that cautery over both eyebrows, a little on top of the two stitches in its entire length, and they are made longer than usual.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the quantity of eyebrow hair.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard on your hand with the cautery, but rather according to the quantity that the cut part of the eyelid is opened.
Capitol .xvi.	The medical treatise is being translated line by line into English.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Cauterizing of the eyelid of the foot when skin is converted to the parts of the dentition and hand to the foot.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the foot is converted to the parts of the dentition in such a way that it bites or hurts the foot, cutting in those places according to two methods: one by applying fire or one by applying medicine that burns.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If applying cauterizing fire on him, command the malady in front of that one to read over those skin areas as well as those that are being muffled, until they are prolonged and healed; and if his foot hurts, then strengthen the soles of that foot with a cloth so that it is not hurted until the skin is born.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then when they are healed and prolonged, afterwards pause the head of the malady on your shoulder, and place a sign over the eyelids of the foot, a token which is according to the shape of an oak leaf, and near the skin.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And place a poultice at the beginning of the toe in an album of wool or in mucus of hairs on the foot.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	The treatment involves applying heat from a cauterium.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Apply cauterization to the figure which has been marked, little by little, in marks visible, while it is burned on the surface of the tendon, so that it appears as if it were a leaf of myrtle.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The sign of good health from your work is that you see the eyelid of the eye closing and the pupils rising, because of the puncture in the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	So therefore lift up your hand and lay it on that point for three days, and place your pause over it at the border until the scar is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Apply treatment to that wound until it heals.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if it returns through the hairs due to some cause and the eyelid becomes soft, then do another cauterization on that as you did originally.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are left on the eyelid, then cauterize it so that it is elevated to its natural place and closed, lest they pierce the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	The translation is: "But the cautery is a medicine that burns what you command the sick person to do, until they are prolonged and enclosed, and place it of cloth in the shape of a mint leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	The translation is: "And take some of the onion and of the live worm a finger's breadth away from it, or as much as you like, mix well those causes with the meat, and make this festivity so that it doesn't get inflamed; and apply that over the cloth which has been made just like the shape of mint leaf, and place that on both, and place the other handle on top in a vessel of honey, and the patient's head is in your hand.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	The translation is: "And place it [the medicine] on the patient's lips so that they do not swallow it until they feel the biting of the medicine, as if it were fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	The translation is: "And when he perceives that the other biting has stopped, then read out the medicine and apply it to your own hand; therefore when the biting stops, afterwards remove the medicine with soap and water; and afterwards consider how many times the eyelid will be lifted like as if it had been washed by the stricture of fire or incision, for this is good; and if it does not return to that of the medicine on the place where no heat has been applied and is not contracted into your hand until you have completed your operation and are closed up with the nail.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	To pause over the spot until the nodules of constriction are eradicated, and to cure them in this position or elsewhere where they may heal.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	It is necessary to you that you perform your operation with great vigilance, lest you fall from the medicine, and if the eyelids become soft after seven days, and there is no cause for the redness of the skin in the foot, then iterate your medicine over that place where the eyelids are softened, and thus do what was done at the beginning, and turn around to ensure healing.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the form of myrrh leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	You know that the feet of men are different in size and shape, therefore according to this it is done with your contraction.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	It will not be hidden the path of the correct treatment for that which is studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of a fistula that is in the tear duct of the foot.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula in this way, as we have discussed the divisions of illnesses and do not trust your healing method, then, cover yourself that you cauterize it according to this manner: command the patient to pause his head in your shoulder, and hold his head with any minister between your hands in such a way that it may not be moved nor agitated by its head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And place your hand in the fold of the shoe or on the albumen of the skin, or on the mucus of hair over the foot.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And apply the cautery from which this is the form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is shaped like a cane or a pen with a sharp point, from one end to the other, to which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, penetrate into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to come out like a spear.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But still that which is closed is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And apply ointment to the fistula if it is open, and bring out and dry that.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	If there is no opening, then open it up and extract the pus.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Place your hand on the one that holds the cautery which is properly ignited, and touch it with your other hand just at the heel until the cautery of the heel reaches the opening of the nose, so that you do not burn your hand or make the ulcer inflamed. Then place the cautery in the grey area of the heel and corrupt that.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	So if at the beginning of your cautery you pierce into the bone, it is good; but if not, then iterate the cautery one time or two if necessary; and let that area be laid open for three days, and place a border around it with a dry and scalding ointment until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if it has not healed after eleven days, then place a medicinal medicine corrosive in the area until the bone is exposed and cut according to what is convenient in its capital.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	Another way of cauterizing a fistula which they first called: place yourself in the location of the fistula and cut that out and take a pause in that subtle fissure, where is the shape of it: E put on there one unc of melted lead; and your hand placed gently with good retention, so that the ulcer does not worsen so that the melted lead does not reach the heel of that; and see how you place your hand over the heel of the ulcer close to the album of wool or water, where the lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it by marvelous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	If the fistula is healed as we have said about cauterization and cure, then it is good. And if not, it is necessary to administer some treatment through the nose and reduce the fistula into the nasal passage according to where it comes in its own place.

De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cautery for a wound in the foot.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Various accidents have caused fissures in the lips, and especially in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	So that you treat those fissures as we have said in the divisions and do not overdo your treatment, then use small hot knife cautery according to this form:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And it is placed in the cavity of him as follows by the subtlety of the spoon.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	And place that instrument cautiously in the fissures until the cautery reaches the root of the fissure.

Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Treatment of fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an apostoema occurs at the base of the uvula or palate, or at the root of the teeth, and you tie it off and cut it open, and then break it and push a stick in, if that produces a fistula, treat the wound accordingly, not knowing the cure beforehand. For your own safety, know how to cauterize according to the quantity received in the fistula, put that knife into the track of the fistula, and hold your hand inside so that the hot iron comes close to the point of it, and at the end, make this a second or third time; and treat the wound as we have told you before until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And therefore, if the wound is closed and healed, it's good; but if not, you should discover the place and remove the corrupted bone according to its head.
Capitol .xx.	Head or source.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Treatment of the cauterization of teeth and softening of the ligaments.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the ligaments are softened by moisture and the teeth are swollen, treat them with medicine but do not trust in this treatment, unless you pause the head of the patient on your thigh, so that you place the cauterizing instrument in the shape it comes to be, in order to pause when it will pass through the hole into the tooth suddenly; and take hold of it firmly, a small one, so that the mouth centers the heat of the fire at the base of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Please lift your hand, and please repeat the cautery some whiles according to what you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And now let the patient drink water with salt in his mouth for an hour, and see whether that stops it, because the tooth is stopped up and the gum is softened, and the moisture corrupted is dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the cautery for toothache pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is caused by coldness, or if there is frost or worm in it, you do not apply treatment with medicine, but rather cauterize it according to two methods: either with cow's border (presumably a mixture of burnt bone or hoof) or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautering with cow's border is that you take a piece of cow's bone, boil it in a metal pot, and wrap it around the extremity of the finger, then emerge the hot, burnt bone, and place it on the painful tooth constantly until it has cooled.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeat that [cauterizing with cow's border] some whiles until the virtue of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	If you see, you should submerge wool or cotton in the border of what was said, and pause it on the aching tooth, and wait for that hot iron to pass into the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	But the cauterization is not to touch if you wait for the burning time or of fire, and so that it does not reach into the mouth of the illness.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And place the hot cautery in the shape it comes in, and pause it on the tooth, and hold your hand between that cauteri so long as it is heated; and do this occasionally when the pain subsides or one day or another.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is clear that by the impression of that cauteri, the illness will open its own mouth to better border and hold it for an hour and then spit; and this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	Cauterize it as far as you see fit, according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the canula:

De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Treatment of external protrusions.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When swellings are caused by excessive and cold humors and do not respond to the application of medicines for digestion, you should give a gentle treatment of digestion to those. E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit. De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Treatment of ulcer with cautery and constriction of bile.

E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	And let the patient lie on their back for forty days until they are sealed in the place and the plague is cured.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And cover that the patient's nourishment is according to the length of time of their healing, lest they weaken the belly, and lest the hernia comes out because of the effort to cure.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And after forty days, as soon as you take them away, administer some medicine well made, and keep them for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And it should be reduced in work and in replenishment of food and drink and voice, for as long as you use this regimen of healing the whole body will be healed.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat. De cauterizacio de torcio.	On the cautering of a tumor.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt. E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And it is the pointed cautery of the entire limb according to its size and shape, value and location, and nature of the tumor and pain.

Therefore if the patient is healed with the first cautery, well; but if not, then it is iterated upon him the pointed cautery; because by custom of those pains it is that they should be punctured on the same part as the pain, so that you can obtain them with the cautery before the sickness heals.

De cauterizacio de lepra.	Treatment of Leprosy
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Some leprosy cases are treated with cautery due to a large wound, and only when the leprosy type caused by rotting of flesh and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	Therefore, when you want to cauterize him, consider if the leprosy is common and has that cure mentioned in the division, but do not apply it, lest it spread and comprehend the entire body and all its complexity, therefore cauterize him on the head with a cautery of 1 at the middle of the head, and the second from behind his ears; and one over both temples, and one behind, over the nape or shoulder.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally, apply your hand with the cautery a little inside before it seizes onto the bone, and the scars will be displaced, so that the exhalation of great vapors is alleviated from him; and cauterize on the belly as needed.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	If the leprosy is already expanded over the ulcer and appears manifestly, then cover that you cauterize him with those cauteries mentioned in the head; and cauterize on the tip of the nose, and two cauteries on both knees, and two on both shoulders, and one large on each shoulder, and one on the shoulder, and two on the ankles, and one on each ankle, and two on the hams, and one on every hamstring, and two on the muscles, and two on the tendons of his foot; and cauterize him over all the joints of the arms and legs and feet, and on any toe of his feet, and on the folds of his breasts.

E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	It is known that the cauterizations can be large or small, depending on the limbs and joints, as indicated by the types of tools used.
