E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And then I shall begin this, since it is about the cutting of flesh, the sons of the doctors who are learning in this chapter, as much as in the first chapter on cauterization.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And therefore, the apprentice should be in great caution, because in this operation there are many times evacuated blood which is mixed with the wound, and by which the patient's life is put at risk, through the application of the vein or incision on the swelling or discharge, or purulence of the plague, or extraction of a splinter or incision of a wound, and similar things.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And when all those things are done, he will be accompanied by great fear and trembling, and in the worst part of his belly, death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	I warn you to beware of this situation, for it has caused many people with madness from men to become mad from various kinds of illnesses.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And so it is that from them you will find themselves with their illness and the lightness of death, and thus because of the severity of this thing, they find their illness, and because of the length of their illness, and there is fear of the disease which signifies death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And those who give you their child and daughter, they expect to find health in them, but their illness is deadly.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore be cautious that you do not consent to one from whom you see this kind of madness; and your caution should be greater than covetousness, and your rapidity; and do not presume any cause about it except for sure certain knowledge which validates this thing for you, and to which success is deservedly due.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the cure of all your illnesses prognosis and indication of it to which healing is converted; for in that one you will be aided on the acquisition of fame and memory, honor and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Oh sons, God is watching your understanding and not abandoning you in your direction and protection, because this is in your hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I ordered this distinguishing chapter according to the capitals as it follows in the capital of cautery, cure of the head among the feet, so that it may be alleviated by you what is sought from it and which you have had need of.
Capitol primier.	Chapter first.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	The healing of water, which is contained in the head of children.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Be aware that this disease often moves to the children, and when the night fever sets in, it opens up the head of the child.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And sometimes it moves because of a hidden cause that is not known.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But I have not seen this disease in children except in those who you see are dying, and for that reason it seems to me to be a sign of death in those.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen that a child whose head was filled with water, and the head of him remained magnificently expanded so that it could not be compressed over itself due to the size of his head, and moreover that the humidity became significantly reduced within himself as soon as he stopped breathing.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this humidity is added between the cartilage and the bone, or it accumulates elsewhere on the bones.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	And the operation on him if the humidity is between the cartilage and the bone and the apothema is little, often cover that you make incisions in the middle of the head at a fissure in latitude, and the length of the fissure should be two times as long as it takes for the humidity to run, and this is the form of the spatula:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	If therefore the humidity is greatly increased and the swelling is more pronounced, then it can cause two fissures in this manner:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	If the humidity is in the bones, then it is a sign that you will open both corners of the mouth with all its partition and the water is squeezed when you press it on your hand at the joints and not inside.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	Cover that you open in the middle of the head with three fissures in this manner:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And therefore take out the excessive humors from all the body; and tie the fissures with cloths and plums; and apply this on top with vinegar every fifth day, and untie the bandage and cure the wound by applying poultices and herbal infusions, and strengthen the head with equality; and eat the sick one a dry meat of little humidity until the member is comforted and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another method of cutting that I consider suitable when it comes to the size of the swelling and the collection of water, because sometimes it is more in the occipital region, or at the anterior, right, or left part, and therefore make the incision where the swelling appears and fill it with water as much as possible.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And observe that you must not cut the artery and try to find the flow of the disease through this flow of disease, in order to evacuate the humidity from the body.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter II.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Concerning the cutting of arteries which are located under the armpits, called hilases.
Capitol segon.	Chapter Second.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When you encounter any catars or wounds on the heel or the foot, and it has been an old condition, and you do not rely on this for the cure of medicines, then it is at the beginning of those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	Therefore, when you want to cut those (arteries) which the disease has reached its head, and take care of cleaning the place with a rough cloth so that the arteries appear, and tie up the neck of the patient with multiple cloths; and consider if you press on the vein; and keep those places hidden until they are exposed in some humans.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And take care to press on the artery at the point, and cut each one with a sharp instrument at the split of each part that enters into the bone, so that it is done for the latitude of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	If you want, insert the spatula between the artery and that which is torn at the entry of the wound to tie it up accordingly.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	The length of the incision should be two fingers adjusted, because when any vein is cut, the blood spurts outward and then again starts pulsating.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear on the surface, then cover that you measure from the armpit the quantity of the space of three fingers, and approach slowly, and feel inside the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	This is the quantity of blood that must be drawn off, one unit, and lightly so, not more or less, and all this is according to the amount which appears from the virtue of the illness and the swelling of the artery.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And take into account the plague, therefore if there remains over the bone any cause of abscess, then cut this off in order not to invite post-emptory cauterization.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And take strong the plague with plums and linen bandages, and cure that one with ointment inside until it is sane.
Capitol .iii.	The beginning of the treatise.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	Removal of the bowstrings which are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When accidents occur where the artery migrates to the ancient or catarrhal spot, due to humidity and quality in the lacrimal ducts of the temples, or because they are ancient and similar to those, you treat them with various methods of curing medicine, but do not confirm, for we have seen in these diseases, removal of the bowstrings from the temples, or cauterization of that place as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the method of the operation and removal is what causes the malady to spread through the skin where it is in the temple; and observe the artery that appears in the temple as when you show it to its owner, because it is concealed only in a few men by extreme cold.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is concealed, then the skin of the malady is strengthened with no covering cloth; and apply coldness to the place with a harsh cloth or evaporate the place with hot water until the artery appears manifestly.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then take the spatula of which this is the form:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	You should untie the cord at that place where you will facilitate entry into the archery; and get on to it where you can extract those parts above that, while extracting them from the cord and discovering those of the tunics which are left behind in all part.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is subtle, then wrap around that with the extremity of the one finger, and cut through it according to the length by which the limbs of him are prolonged and contracted, lest you do not find the flow of blood, for if they were not closed, it would not rise from all.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And now evacuate the blood one vessel into three.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	But if the archery is great, then cover that with you lying it in two places with firm double cord or with ropes long, and do not cut to it the putrid flesh before the consolidation of the plague, lest you find the flow of blood.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And cut the superfluity which is between two ligaments, and do it in that hour or at another time.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	If you want, sterilize that area with a pointed instrument inside the bone and cut it in such a way that the edges are folded inward, so that it remains in its place.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	It is a better work if the patient has fever or cold symptoms, rather than an infection, because cauterization can help to close those final moist pores, and therefore it is better to do it quickly.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	Cover the excision of the arteries that are made in the same place as they were before, and cover it with powder decently made, and apply its cure with medicinal powders, so that the flesh and marrow may become nourished inside.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	If while you work another vein happens to break or bleed due to the cutting of the artery, then you should restrain that flow either by pressing the wound or by cauterizing it, and tighten your hand in order to restrict the bleeding.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	If no cause of those things is known to you, then pause your words about the place where the wound is congealing, and put the place with hot water of fervent temperature until the accuracy rests, and tighten it as needed.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	It is lighter to operate on an archer due to the cauterization of the vein with this cauterium having two handles, since you have seen the two locations in the attempt, and placed some material, ignited, until it reaches the bone and separates the vein into two locations, so that what is between their limbs is elongated, which is not consolidated from top to bottom by this cauterization.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	This is the form of the cauterium:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	The sharpness of the two handles is equal.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	However, if there are only two sharpnesses, it is better with two handles, because if they are needles like two handles together, and they pierce the flesh quickly, and do not incise it.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore, when there is no any growth, the heat of the fire is held on those places and the flesh is separated lightly.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	This work is better than all the others and therefore lighter.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And this space between two handles is equal to the amount of the growth mentioned.
Capitol quart.	The capital quarter of the body contains the heart.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	On the treatment of acute and chronic wounds on the sores.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When chronic wounds occur, and are due to those veins that lie under the skin of the forehead, and no remedy can be applied from medical knowledge, and sometimes the face of the sick person turns red, and they walk with a wobbling motion as if walking like ants, the sores of that person become severely twisted and swollen, and their eyes are scorched by the sharpness of tears, and it is usual to mix these remedies in the treatment of those from this operation, and we call this remedy spassa.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And therefore you command the sick person to shave their beard where it is on their forehead, and place three incisions on the forehead, spaced apart equally in length along the forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the incision is twice a unit: one incision should be spaced out equally along the length from the nose to the midpoint of the forehead, and the other according to the length of half the movement of the eyelids, where the tears fall on the lacrimal, and the third on the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	Watch carefully at the beginning of the arches that are in two parts, and stretch your hand to continue from both sides of the jawbones.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space at each opening is the length of three fingers' width, adjust it.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if there is to you a swelling of pus or dressing that clings to it, and you dry the surrounding skin.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And so enter the space between the two acute extremities, from which this is the form of the opening:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	which corresponds to the entrance into the second opening between the temples.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Excavate the entire chain that is between two openings, with the forceps on the bone, and return this opening half-way into the second opening.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And place the string in this space and enter into the first opening again, with another instrument called a cutter, sharp from one side and blunt from the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	Pause the side of that sharp one where the attached flesh meets the chain, and the side on the other bone, and push it into where it will reach the half-way fissure, and cut through all those vessels that descend from the head to the heels.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	It seems to be describing an operation on a patient.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	The pain in the feet of a person sick will come from the quantity of blood poured out, express the places of the feet with congruent.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	Place your hand in every wound that is filled with old blood, and place on those powder-like things in the vein and oil and vinegar which do not seek to form an aposteme (i.e. an abscess).
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	On the third day, tie up the limb and administer great flow of cold water or bear flesh, and apply cure to it with basilikon (i.e. a concoction of onions, vinegar, and oil) and other things that will heal the wounds.
Capitol .v.	It seems like there's an incomplete line or a break in the text. Is the treatise complete?
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	On the treatment of warts by cauterization and using oils that descend from cuts on the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When the vein is cauterized and continues to swell, and sometimes the oils of the sickness are applied in small amounts, and then one examines their weakness, and ulcerated eyelids, and on their chest there is sharp and intense pain and subsequent swelling, therefore it is understood by these accidents that materials and cauterizations do not enter into the vein but through small veins from the parts of the head.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	Here's the guessed translation:
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dried all the skin around the swollen or moist area or cloth, and fill it between the two folds of the old scar or cloth.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	Put on the powder inside in vinegar and oil, so that it does not become inflamed with gangrene.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when this occurs and you see that the gangrene has decreased, then press on the bone inside where it starts to manifest in flesh, and apply that wet dressing which makes the flesh rise, as if you were taking two parts of wheat flour and four parts of ink and mix them, and make a paste from it, and apply it on these wounds of flesh.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	On the cure of those who are afflicted with gout in the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	All the causes that afflict the ears are one of four kinds: either they are mineral in nature, similar to stone, like iron and vinegar, or they come from plants, such as thyme or lentil, or they are fluid-like, like water and vinegar, or some kind of animal.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	When the pain is located in the ear or another cause similar to those that do not fit on the ear, and place the ear in the sun, and sometimes bring it down, then distill in that particular cause of oil violated or si-zami, and take out the extraction, and make him stornutate am condizi, and observe the nars must happen the event of stornutatio.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And place in the circuit of the ear some pieces of cloth or wool, and extend the ear to its parts, as many times it has been forgotten with these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not forgotten, then take out the extraction of him with the instrument called gesture epicicaria subtle, of which this is the form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is forgotten with the gesture, well; and if not, then take out the extraction of him with a subtle needle duplication.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And therefore, if it is not forgotten by this means, then take out the canal of arm and insert the extremity of the canal in the channel of the ear, and close with wax and molten oil so that there may be a blockage only the canal.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	You are about to feel the pain of the bowels in your intestines because you have been watching this for too long.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	If it is not forgotten in this manner, then take half an onion or vinegar dressed with the kind of oil you are holding a needle in, and place that on the end of your finger, and wrap around that area comfortably placed.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	Put that (the onion or vinegar) into the crack of the armpit with ease, and gently clean the armpit from moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And therefore if it is not forgotten all the causes that have been recounted, then you cut your toe in front of you so as to discover a cauter or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the way of cutting that is to first season the malevolent vein and cut it from the sign according to the virtue of it, and place your hand over that, and convert the armpit into its parts, and make a small fissure in the root of the armpit with grey of it in the place before mentioned.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	It seems to be describing a surgical procedure for hernia repair.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	If the cause of the pain in the armpit is a swelling that grows and gets inflamed, then administer treatment and extract it; but if you do not obey my advice, then you will have to take a subtle ointment according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	Administer to that person the extraction of that growth which has fallen in the armpit.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	Do not do this when you think that the growth is already moistened by the vapor of the armpit, and put it in hot stones, and extract it from those places or with a subtle gesture, as has been said previously, because this relieves the extraction.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But if the water that has been introduced into the armpit covers the symptoms of the malady with sneezing, fill its armpit with a certain kind of vinegar, and pour water over that armpit where the water is, and if by this means it is forgotten, then so be it; but if not, then take hot pepper tea and lemons according to the length of the cut, and warm those up in the fire for a little, and have the patient insert one of them into the track of its armpit and press on one side with another stone over that part which is within the armpit.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	And do not cease until all of that water has been forgotten.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc i, e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And then take the water and pour it into paper or guncarion, and place one end of it on the ear and stretch the other end with fire until the top of him is burned.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then place the other guncarion and pour water into it as many times as necessary until all of that water is forgotten, and tie back that which protrudes from the ear due to said extrusion.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But if the extraction of the animal's part enters into that ear, and it is small, apply pressure and make it similar to what we said in the division; but if it is large which causes appearance on the skin sometimes, then administer the extraction with gestures and touches, and the cause becomes lighter than all other causes that afflict the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But if the extraction of the worm is born in the ear, when you treat that water which we said in the division and in the treatment of the distillations, but do not confide in your cure, then be sure to cover that the ear until it is exposed to the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	If then any cause of the worms appears here, now remove that amulet or subtle gesture, but if there is no cause, then take a cannula and stick it straight through and wide open from which this is its form.
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And introduce the subtle extremity into the aura according to the quantity which was enough to bring on the illness; and take a suckling pig to suck strong, and do this many times, until all the worms are expelled.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if it does not obey to your assistance, then pull and close the opila in the tube of the cannula with wax as we have said; now administer the stomachatics which have already been used in the treatment of worms, and find that here in the tract of stomachatics.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is the place where you pour the medicinal oils onto the aura with that instrument from which it comes:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make that of silver or horn, straight, with a small notch on top and a plate below.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And therefore it is necessary to push them into the cavity of the continence canal, where they will be forced.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	If you wish, take the lance and envelop it in the extremity of him decently wrapped, and place oil in the cavity of the swelling, or the juice of some herb, or water that you want from these medicines into the canal— and that is in the armpit —, and take the lance again wrapped above and press your hand upon it so that the oil is driven out into the cavity of the swelling and the patient feels the oil draining out of him.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And what is put into the armpit is already scorched by fire a little.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	Be careful that the cause you will discover in the armpit is not too cold, because the medicines of the armpit do not withstand this.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of cure for opacification of armpits.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some times the flesh swells in the armpit of children who have not had a bowel movement, and this occurs sometimes in women, opacification in the meat of the armpit due to plague or other skin problems; and sometimes it is caused by something on the underside of the arm which they do not notice, and sometimes it is in the outer parts.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	When something happens to a patient in bed, which they cannot understand, it is usually due to the most difficult form of sickness.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that case where you can understand what is happening to the patient, cover your face from the sun and observe it more closely.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore when sometimes oppression appears openly, open up with a subtle rod of that kind which is the form of it:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the extremity of the patient, where the length is small, and one part is acute and another not; and the rod is of two lengths to prevent it from making a disturbance on the face.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And therefore if the opacity is caused by a natural skin condition on the face or in the flesh of the patient, then apply that rod subtly and make gentle incisions until all the skin is removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if opacity is in the hollow of the face, then take a subtle rod and burn that area with a small focus for a little while, and place it into the flesh of the face.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And so if you have sensed oppression about this that the disease is affected by ease, due to the weight of losing it, try to overcome its ease; and be careful not to plague the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Now hold the ear bandage in place on the second according to how wide the traction is which you have wrapped around the neck, this being done for three days until you are sure of the consolidation of the plague; or if you take water and put that into it and apply it to the ear with a mixture of thorns and use it; and if the ear has already become supplicated, then cover that quailga and permutate it in another quailga which you have wrapped in cerot with olive oil, until the supplicated area becomes cauterized.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if a bloody discharge happens, then submerge the sponge or bandage in water and apply it to the ear, and use the other remedy which restricts the flow of the discharge, which is said in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	Healing of blindness which has occurred in the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Blindness that occurs in the eyes of people who have been hanged, sometimes due to the lack of moisture, and sometimes due to dryness.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Then cover those with a gauze or cloth, and place it over the affected area after applying a poultice made of a mixture.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if the pain is accompanied by a flow of blood from the vein, then you should cauterize those areas with a subtle antiseptic cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cautery is to apply the incision and treatable wounds again when there is no remaining cause of the reaction; and when those areas are cauterized, they burn and do not return.

Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Treatment for the swelling that occurs in the eyelids of the hanged.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Sometimes swelling occurs in the eyelids of the hanged without any apparent cause, which is assembled into giantness in strength and hardness, and therefore it is called giantism.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	There is a large addition of humidity in the eyes above and below.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	So the operation for them is that when you consider the size of the growth, if it originates from the eyelid and is mild throughout the entire area; and the cause of this is slight.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore look over that fissure with latitude, and approach the opening of that entire area with ease, and approach it with oil and cut it off.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if it is not suitable to approach the beginning of it, unless you penetrate the eyelid at the starting point, a little by little, because otherwise there is no notice of any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the figure is large, then you adjust it with stitches; and cure it inside until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it's little, you won't suffer much because of it, since the blood of it restores that and fills it up.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the size is declining in the parts outside of the eyelid's margin, then you cover that part with the surface; otherwise, you lift the eyelid and suspend the size with oil, other than when you suspect the starting point, and press it on the entire area, and if the eyelid is swollen at the starting point, there is no notice of any cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	Open the beginning, wash the foot in salted water; and cure the place with that which is inserted into it so that healing takes place.
Capitol .x.	This line appears to be a title or heading, as indicated by the abbreviation ".x." (often used in medieval manuscripts to indicate a section or chapter). It doesn't provide direct translation.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	On the treatment of ingrown toenails on the foot.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Inflammation that is generated in the tunics of the ingrown toenail, and especially in children, worsens foot ulcers and leads to their major catarrh; and because they cannot withstand the clarity of sunlight, they become even more inflamed with tears.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And so you should wash those wounds on the face at all times, and on their faces while they sleep; and over their eyes place wet combs, which have covered inflammation, and imminent acernac (inflammation) is in the toe; and when you press the area with your thumbs, you feel acernac between them.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And there is no operation to be done on the patient who lies his head in your hands, and places a damp cloth on him, and makes a circle according to the amount of arthurnach (presumably "arthritis") present in that part; and he presses with his thumbs over all that so that acernac is aggravated in the middle of the circle; and then one applies heat in the middle of that humidity with a sponge incident on the fissure, lest the fissure be greater than the fissure made in flaubotomia.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	When the disease is near, you will cut the ligament all the way through until you reach the joint, for in many cases the joint process has a fissure according to the shape of the white flesh.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Then remove the bandages which you have wrapped around between your fingers to the parts in front and behind, and turn between your right and left hand until it is spread apart.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And guard that you do not adjust the fissure, lest the splint does not go through the heel and damages that area.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	But if you do not see an appearance of the joint in the beginning of the fissure, then adjust in the fissure a little ease inside that you process, and remove that assiduity which we have said; and put drapes of linen in water vinegar and oil, and place them on the location and stretch those with powder.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And so, add salt and place it in the cavity of the fissure, so that what is removed by that humidity.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And treat it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	If it happens in the place where the cauterization was done, then cure that wound with stitches inside until it heals.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter .xi.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Of the usual methods of treatment by touch.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When in the eyes of a patient (hues) swelling occurs due to tight clothing and has caused wrinkles, it is customary to treat with natural means and antiseptics. And if so, these are applied to the eye and done in various ways to cure ailments such as persistent tears, softening of eyelids and tissue inside until this destruction of the eye that calls for touch, and a cure can be done in four methods: either by cauterization with fire; or by acute medicine according to what is said in the chapter on cauterization; or through surgical touch with stitching; or by needles as you have instructed.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And therefore cover that the head of the sick person on your side; convert the eyelid of the eye with your left hand, and if it is converted, then it is so; if not, insert a needle in the place where the eyelid parting is most faithful from its original position, and drive the needle through the conjunctiva above, and thus — very close to the edge of the eyelid, at the skin level—very close to the skin, and pull the thread to the parts above the eyelid, and convert it with that.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt. D’eradicacio de dentz.	Dent extraction.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu. Unless the illness is very close to that tooth, you must be certainly certified which is the painful tooth, for how many times has the pain disappeared from the patient and if it returns to it when a healthy tooth is extracted, and you extract that one and place the pain not until the sick and painful tooth is extracted, for we have seen this before by operation of the barbers.

De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	About the cure of great teeth and others.
