E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	This means: "And it is another method of operation in the suffumigation, that you take a roll in which are carbolic sparks and the roll is covered with a coverlet in the middle of which is a tract, and this tract is composed of the extremity of the instrument; and therefore you apply the subfumigation; and place the malady's mouth at the extremity of the canula, and close its mouth so that the subfumigation is not forgotten until you know that the subfumigation has reached the sanguisuga, for then the sanguisuga will come.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	This means: "And if not cured, then you repeat the subfumigation several times, and abstain from making the patient drink, eat salty foods and ashes, and do not give them water, and thus it is necessary that this regimen be forgotten.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	This is the shape of the instrument with which the pus from the abscess when it's seen; and it resembles forceps somewhat like times, unless it's curved.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed on the abscess, and its extremity is similar to a bee's tongue, which is good, because it is sharpened with lime, so that when we compress any cause, that one will not stick.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter XL.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the summary of the sermon in regard to apertures and sections of them.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	The apostemes are of special sorts, of various kinds, according to what is remembered about them in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in perforation and section of them by two kinds, of which one is for the kind of apostemes themselves; and because we compress the humors.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second way is for the localities in which accidents of the body occur, whereby an abscess occurs in the head is different from one that occurs in the anus; and an abscess in a fleshy place is different from one in a joint; and each one has its own property for operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	The text says: And in warts, some are covered that should not be pierced unless the sickness has matured in those places or is completed by them.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	Other warts which should be pierced when they are crosses, and not matured according to their completion, become thus similar to joint pains, because if an wart appears near a joint, it is prolonged until you pierce that thing which is in the circuit of it, and they are easily corrupted to the ligaments or nerves of that joint, causing contractions of that member; or it is a wart on the principal limb, and if you delay piercing it until it has matured, it will cause damage to the principal limb; or it is on the rectum, therefore pierce that one which is not matured; and do not dare to pierce it, because if you do so, no remedy will come of it and it will be elongated towards all parts away from the rectal opening, forming a fistula, or piercing at the end which should not be done.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	It is known that you can know the time of the piercing of the wart, and so it is when it has matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	When the body is mature and there is cessation of pain and fever, and decrease in heat and pulse, and sharpness of the apothema, and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And how well you know that to pierce into the place where there is pus and from which pus comes out after healing of the prominence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And to pierce through the flesh or the body, whichever is longer, if the apothemas are in the joints of the hands or feet, and on the sinews, ligaments, arteries; and, later, wherever it is not reflected, for those that are reflected, use piercing according to each member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the apothema is in the flesh, it is better to wait until it is confirmed that the digestion has progressed according to the completion, as they have said; for if you pierce it before that, you will prolong the course of the putrid humors and the foul stench, and soften the lips of it, and increase its depth.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But sometimes apothemas are pierced according to the latitude of the flesh or body due to necessity, or as needed.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	I can't help you with that.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	Other are the ones in which it is necessary to conquer and set fire to the cord ( probably referring to the cord or ligature of an apostema), when it's done by placing a piece of wood on top, as it has already become inflamed, like what happens in cases of boils and buboes.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And there are those where the section has three angles, and those in which it is incised so that it resembles the shape of a myrtle leaf, like the ones on the agonizing patients.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And in those where a round section and a lunar section are administered, resembling them.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But that one which does not have the same thing as their superficial agonizing aphthae, you can only perform a superficial or flat incision.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And you should only perforate it if the apostema is large and already has accumulated some pus, not to extract the whole purulent mass at that moment; take out one part of it, cover the wound with a poultice the next day, and then take out another larger part, and do this until the infection is forgotten.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And when the malady is due to green fever, or a woman's press, or a child's smallness, or old man's decay, in which the animal spirit moves is resolved by the exit of the sickness, and strong light causes death, you will open.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	But carefully guard this section, and if you make a perforation in which you pierce these swellings, be careful to wipe off the plague and consider whether the swelling of the piercing is small, or flat, then you will administer remedies for it on one side or the other; but if the swelling is large, and the fissures of the perforation are spreading, be careful, and cover yourself in any track between which they spread until they heal.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If the tendon in the swelling is torn or has been concave at some point, then carefully wrap it with old cloth or woven fabric like you would bandages or strips, adding moisture; and apply it strongly on the third day; and process that and cure it with such poultice as can be applied before the sickness enters.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if you experience bleeding in the hour of your operation, then carefully apply water to wipe it off and vinegar on the wounds where you put a cloth, and pause that over the location of the flowing blood many times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	If the flow of the sickness persists, then cover that you administer the remedy and care, and mix the powders which I have recommended in certain places of this book and division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is in the time of winter, and the place of the swelling is near the nerves, then cover that you pour powdered wine and oil caut over those places.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	But if it is in summer, and the places are fleshy, then cover that you pour crushed egg yolks with water and oil or with wine and oil on those places until it is the third day, just as they have said, and then cover that you remove the swelling, wash it, and administer the remedy that it needs until it is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary for the knowledge of the universal cure for swellings, but as I have already said in general about all swellings in which manner it should be done specifically.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the swellings that occur in the neck of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	The head of the small intestine contains pouches that contain nodules which are made of their own material; and these nodules have different shapes.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	Their contents are balls, and those which contain moisture similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	Those which contain moisture similar to quicklime, and have the same consistency; and those which are stony, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	In the section of all, and in the extraction of those there is no fear; for when the extraction does not cause a rupture.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	The operation in the section of those is where you apply them to the shape of which you see it fitting; that is called an incision, into which you know what contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	When this contains moisture, you split it apart according to its length by section on a surface, following that shape:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	It begins in the section between lines B and G. Then, as soon as the moisture is evacuated, you scrape off that skin which contains that moisture, and do not leave any other cause of it, because if you have seen some return, then there remains some other cause.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	If a wound is covered in Egyptian linen if present, and not, in water and salt; and you fill it with that wound and dress it inside another day, because this corrodes all until the skin of that film.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And now iterate over that wound with Egyptian linen second and thirdly if it is necessary to do so, until you are confident that there is no hole in that film; then heal the wound with linen until it is cured.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	If there are aposterems ( probably "apostema" meaning a swollen part) with knots of fat, then you insert that second in this way:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	 cut through the section with a curved saw, getting one inch between two layers of the section and cutting through it from top to bottom, and force your effort in extracting the skin which contains that.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if it opposes your arrow, then do this as you have recounted previously.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	Do the same thing to the inflamed aposterem of section and of cure, as I have told you; a section on an inflamed aposterem is lighter, because it is of few sutures and little humidity.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	When some swellings appear in the head which are not wet like humans, that is because I once cut open an appendix in the head of an old woman and tore it apart so harshly that it became like a hard, white, unquenchable peony, which could not be pierced, and if anyone hit that area with force, they would be injured.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other swellings that appear on the head it is not like this case, as with those swellings that come to the heads of children, and you have to treat the ears for it, but the section of all these is superficial.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And pause the opening of those from the lower part of them, so that it may alleviate the body of the patient at the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And treat those in the same way as those that require healing.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter XLII.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On the section of scrofulae, which occur in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Some swellings are found even in the neck, and on the axillae, and on the armpits, and some occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	When pain occurs in the neck and those pains are generated between them, and all the scrofula is within its own tunic, and just like in the nodes and apertures of the head, so it happens.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the species of these scrofulas are pains, which are some hard ones, and those that contain humidity, and those that are malignant ones, which do not allow for healing.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore in that one, where you apply good disposition to the Touching, of which the color is manifest and it is proper to the color of the cord, and it is malignant to all part, and not attached to the nerves of the neck, nor to the veins, nor to the arteries, unless as much as you inscribe it with a superficial dryness of the starting point from the previous one towards the end of the body, along the lines G and B, and scratch that entire part, and extend the lips of the cord by an inch or two if necessary, as they say in the apertures of the head, and extract that little bit by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more caution to not inscribe the vein or nerve.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	If the wound is not properly dressed, so that it does not adjust to your hand and cause the patient's illness, and so insert something that should not be inserted; if you do insert a vein or an artery and prohibit yourself from continuing with the operation, then pause in the ulcerous spot covered with trifolium or other powders that stop the flow of blood, and lift the wound, and let it heal inside where the repose of the gangrene is maintained, and so soften the plague and begin to be purged.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the wound is cut open.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation before you have completed it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And ask yourself the indication I gave you whether there is any other cause of the other small swellings, then insert those and clean those.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is in the root of the large swelling, cover yourself so that you do not insert that swelling into its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Cover yourself so that the wound may fall in of itself, folded and secure, while it heals.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	Fill the wound of the cut heel which you have already submitted to the Egyptian papyrus treatment, and cure it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	If you cut that scrofula completely, then cover the two lips of the wound and close them tightly so that there is no more pus.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if there is more pus because of the great size of the scrofula, cover that you understand the reason for cutting it, and remove that, and sew up, as it is said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And that one of the scrofulas which contains humidity, make a superficial perforation there where you feel your place of maturation, and pause the perforation so that it dries up the pus beneath the body, as they have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer the perforation, apply the ointment and likeness to those, so that the corruption may cease.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then when you think the wound has already been cleaned, cover that with the ointment of animal skin until it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Breaking of the hair follicle of the apothecary's nail into the groin.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	Describe the breaking of the hair follicle as an epilhot, and there is no one in our land who has made this.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the sermon of those people.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	In men, there is a curvature of the spine, which should be avoided when extracting the epilhot, lest it be done in such a way that all the veins and major vessels of the disease are here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have warts on the mouth or groin or two aurelhas, when the disease is not in the foot, to avoid perforation, which is done by precision.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Then so that you want to do this, insert the epilhot three times around its circumference, or four small sections for latitude in that area, where there are two circumferences, because the section is on the ciphac, not on the cartilage, and this place is convenient for cutting, as it is free of flesh and the sinews of its bone are loose.

E si vols, cus en le comensament la superfluitat de la codena mollificada am tres cozeduras o quatre e am ferma sutura.	If you want, then cut off the excess softened cord at three or four spots and make a firm suture.
E aprop inscideys entre las suturas; e aprop cura per curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat e caian les fiels.	Appropriate incisions between the suture lines, and apply treatment with care for the other wounds inside until it heals and the fevers subside.

De castracio.	On castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	Be aware that castration is forbidden by law, but it's done anyway because I've forgotten to mention it in this book; and it's not necessary to recall it unless for two reasons: one is so that the doctor knows how to treat the condition when he's questioned about it, and the other reason is that we often need to castrate other animals for our young ones for those purposes, just like with mules, and pigs, and boars, and similar beasts.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And therefore I say that castration is done in two ways: by strangulation or by incision.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	The translation is: "But in the one that is made by violence, the road to the operation is that we will cut the beast into water, in which its veins are softened and loosened, so they can hang.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	And you will take those away with your hand, into which they are resolved, so that they do not appear again after the touch.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	But in castration done by rupture and separation, you will have the beast, and press the cord of the testicles of him with your right hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	And you will tie the suspensory ligament, and incise upon any hollow with a separation between two hollows.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	And you will incise those pus that you have found to be swollen.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	And do not look at those of the cophagus, any cause, but the subtle one that is under the skin.
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	This way of castration is better, which is done by violence, because violence brings a lighter burden, and lays no cause on the testicles that the beast desires to devour.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	Cure the wound before it is healed.

E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	The cure for this is to stretch and insert it, or to sew it with a needle or into the skin that fits.

E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	They are already eradicated inwards and outwards with the instrument which you direct.
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	Mites are small, feathered or fistulous, large protrusions on the surface of the body, and when it touches that area, it is 100 times like a bug's bite, and it is made in the body.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	The translated text is:
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	If you want, do this by introducing a cannula into the arm or metal through that form.
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	So that the passage of the cannula may be carried out with subtlety, silent (and so not perforated), wrapped in such a way that on the said point the apprehension of it is abolished and the revolution of that.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	If you want to cauterize the skin according to what is said in the cauterization of athel ( likely a reference to Athelstan, a medieval doctor) in the capital of cauterization.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	Of the instruments that are administered to give punctures.
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Sometimes punctures are made of silver or lead or of cauterized iron, and sometimes with those small instruments that are given, whether large or small, according to which ones you administer, as the one administered to the cure of small children is small; and of those in whose buttocks ulcers or painful swellings occur, their punctures are also small.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The form of large and few punctures.
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The head of the cannula above which the pouch is tied is made large in this manner; and it is at this place that there is a distinction where the pouch is tied as often.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the end of it which is inserted into the rectum becomes numb (not painful) to the touch; and there are two tracks in one side of it and a track on the other, and its width is as large as the size of the hairs and greater one smaller.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	It is the pouch in which medicinal substances are placed such as urine of beast or sheep skin, and its size is one palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	It is perforated with tracks in the same way as it is rolled up; and if the space between the tracks is large enough for the said thing.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And it is inserted into those tracks tightly, fastened with strong thread or with raw linen which has three threads; and when it is placed in that spot, the pouch becomes straight at the base of the anus between two distinct marks, firmly tied to a string: but the quality of tying a string to that place is that you fill the pouch with medicine, warmed according to the amount of the patient's tolerance; and be careful that it is not too hot or too cold.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	It is customary to turn the patient over on their back and elevate their legs, then placing an animal hide or cloth over them and holding someone or a lance; and applying the cauterized point with oil, wax, or gum or honey or plant resin or of fenugreek or similar substances; and inserting that into the anus with ease, and the minister taking hold of the rectum and extracting as much as possible from there, while it is being evacuated in the intestine all that exists in the bladder; and then removing the bladder and lifting the patient onto the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	If the medicine is not successful, hold out as much as it can bear; and if he sleeps on that for the whole of a night, it will be more advantageous to wait.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	But perhaps if you purify him through the solution of intestines and counteract his illness, then iterate the cauterized point until he is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if his anus is bloody or has apertures of leaden colour, then make the cauterized point subtler and softer than those with which the children are purged.
De curacio de las plaguas.	A cure for wounds.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	And you have stated in the division of a cure for wounds that this is suitable for free men, and I say thus, the cure for those wounds is done with the hand and with medicines according to the complement.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Then it is said that wounds are diversified according to where they fall on the body.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the reasons why wounds occur are as follows: by a fall from a height, or a puncture of space, or percussion with an arrow, or with a fist, or with a spear, or similar causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	But wounds that occur on the body parts are as follows: a wound like one that strikes the head, or the neck, or the foot, or the belly, or the groin, and similar to those of the limbs.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I recommend a cure for certain wounds where that reasoning and rule apply to other wounds.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will start with the simple wounds of the head, since the remembrance of the composed parts will come at the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	When simple pain occurs in the head and is not a fracture, then consider: if it is due to a rain or similar, and has already broken down the chain so much that it is a great pain and fear over that malady of apoplexy, caution, you should coat and flebotomy immediately, and do not delay; and extract from that wound according to the value of the virtue of the patient, if there is no other cause that prohibits flebotomy, more so when the remedy that is extracted from the pain is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	It is the opposite of flebotomy, for it is a return to the fullness of the wound; and take care of the patient's intake, both of food and drink, and heavy victuals.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	But if there is some caution that prohibits any cause, then reduce the food and do not approach flesh or drink.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And pause over the wound, if to it occurs apoplexy caution, coat with olive oil soft or in wine where it is stificated.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	But if it is secure of apoplexy caution, then pause over the wound, if it is recent and the air has not changed that powder which I recommended you to apply little.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	If the air has already changed that, then pause over the swollen area until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the wound is large or due to a space and similarity, and the lips are not properly closed for ulcers, then adjust those with stitches according to what you recommend for their stitch.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	But if the wound has already uncovered the bone and tendon, and is not retention of it, but rather a small suspender, then inscribe that and adjust the cure of the wound with medicines and restore the flesh in its place instead of contraction, and command the malady to be cut away from food in which there is grossness: capes and forms similar to it, until it becomes composed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	But if you find rotting flesh in the tendon and it does not adhere to the bone, then inscribe all that into a pit and throw it away, and adjust its cure.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	But if in these wounds there is an artery or vein from which bleeding can occur and it cannot be cut with medicine, then inquire about the artery, and if you find that uncut artery, then inscribe it with a spatula, or ligate it; and if necessity requires, provoke until what has been said does not comfort you, then cauterize.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	If these plaques are simple and small, then their cause is easy to detect; in that case you should crush those into powder, so that when the air solidifies it will change them.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	The way of the powder is as follows: mix olive oil from an ounce cut into pieces one, dragon's blood from two ounces cut into pieces two, and three parts of the root not extinct cut into pieces three; so that it is all mixed together and crushed, and the plague is filled and constricted within a bone with good constriction, and coagulated by the sanc.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And bind the bandages tightly with powder and let them off slowly, lest you not be careful while it is still attached so that the medicine is not effective before it heals.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	There is no cure for this alone, unless you have the powder of dragons and the sanc.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	You already did this type of operation on great plagues when it is convenient to stop them and close them up, especially on those recent plagues whose air has not been altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	When a fracture occurs at the bone, and it's small, then you should take care of it.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And I know the cure for fractures in the head, which is poisonous.
De las plaguas del col.	About the wounds of the neck.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if the wound occurs on the neck, then it's not in its difference in treatment, and between wounds of the head which are simple.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	But if the nerves of the neck are cut or the artery, then if it's the nerve, do not treat there because it will cause violent inflammation, just as one would with a boil, and so say that it is like a vetriol ( possibly meaning "petrified" or "numb") and similar to the nerves, counteract it.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not put pressure on the wound for any cause of inflammation, because the substance of the nerves is inflamed and the continuity of it is in the brain, which is the greatest pus of all the members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if it is so that the wound is treated with lighter medicines, just as one causes the cleaning with warm water, some vinegar or unperfumed oil, and thus when it is cleaned with warm water and the other parts are touched in that way, and anointed with a humecting substance.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	If the wound is large, then administer stitches, or close the lips of the patient, and place care into that area until it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	If the wound has great depth or an accident happens in it and pus starts to come out of it from the lower part, then penetrate that with care into its place where it is most convenient.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	If the wound already has an incised artery and it's possible to get a flow of blood out of it, then separate or dry that one up, tie that one up, or cauterize that one if necessary, for fear of this.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	If already the vertebrae of the spine or all are incised, and the veins of the neck have been saved, then tie the ligaments of the cervical bone with stitches over the canal of the spine, but do not touch that one; cut it equal to that and return it to its natural shape, and tighten it with a decent structure, and let that one heal for acute joints; and cure that one with ointments in which there is stricture and excitement until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	If the wound is already inside the bone, then percuss that, and if there are fragments of bone in it, extract all those you can from them; and what does not fit, let that heal until the wound dries up, and is separated, and the swelling of him be alleviated.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	If the wound is recent, then powder it over that same powder which I have recommended.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	But if there is a fistula in the wound, then cure that with the same treatment which I will mention in my book.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	From wounds in the neck or from similar injuries when there is a space between the shoulder blades, or with a spear or lance, or from a similar blow.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a blow from a lance or spear and the depth penetrates more often than not, then if the wound also shows signs of inflammation like the plague victim's, then you know that the wound is fatal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	If it is not deep and the wound is recent with good health, then put powder on him for the first hour to preserve his health, but hold him away from a sweet drink, and remove that twice a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	If the drink is not available, then put powder into the wound to suck out what is in the humidity; and let the plague patient sleep on the wound covered with a cloth so that the moisture will be confined.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	If the plague has passed for three days or more and there is no malady spasm or heart tremor, nor constriction of the ale, but good other dispositions in the patient, it is known that the plague is saved; then cure them with warm water and another cure until they are healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	But if the patient's recovery is hindered, and they have been open for a long time, then it can be known that already a fistula has been made; cure therefore this one in its head.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the plague is caused by a cut of space or of nail, and it is simple on the surface of the foot or of the toe, then cure that with what precedes suture, if large, or with powder, if small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if already there has been an impression in the bone, and so only those plasters are cut out of them, then you must twist the plague and cut it to remove those plasters, if they are separate.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not separate, then you must cut them in such a way that the plague will ooze out, and the removal of their contents is eased.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	It is recommended for the treatment of other injuries in the other limbs.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of belly wounds.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The condition that occurs in the abdomen is great, moderate, or milder.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	For severe cases, some parts of the intestine or nerve may be inserted into the wound and sutured in a more forceful and subtle manner.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	A small disruption is performed in a different way, and if the retraction of these parts is difficult, then it should be avoided at all costs, because when they are closed and become inflamed, it becomes even more difficult to insert them into their place.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	Therefore the best disruption is milder, because in this case it is not difficult to reattach the intestine, as it is in those two specific cases mentioned before.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	It is known that the sutures of the abdomen are done in four ways, but two of these suture methods are commonly used and apply to other body injuries.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And other two special stitches communicate with other wounds, but however are more proper in the stomach stitch.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	I recommend to each and every one of you an explanation and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	So say that when the wound is small and there is no cause for the intestine to bulge up about it, and it is difficult to reduce it, then this happens in one of two manners: either due to the limited disruption as we have said, or when the intestine has come inflamed by the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when this happens, now cover that you scrape it off so that you submerge a sponge soaked in wine to the wound or pick up something wet like vinegar, cypress, and spikes, and put them inside the intestine until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes you do this in which there is stiphomata, and it is better than using water alone to resolve the inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And therefore when you think the inflammation is resolved, now moisten the wound with water in which it is boiled and mashed apples, because for this the intestines are relieved with little pain.

De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	On the treatment of hernias and the quality of enemas with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula. When the bone is cracked and fractured, it is applied with a plaster made of wheat flour and egg whites, placed on the stop (or elbow) to prevent shock, and if necessary, take humemate, as the Sarrazin (a type of splint or cast), which is long and has an arm span of one palm or less; then apply double powder over the stop and plaster; next take a table stick that is three fingers in length and similar in width; wrap that around the plaster with the stick, wrapped in cloth, and placing it on the site of the fracture, to place humemate as when revolved, roll that back upon the shoulder of him and lets loose the swelling of his arm and the swellings of his disease, reducing him upon all fractured parts; and when the strictness of the fracture is less strained, then it is not concealed.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And that the table stick is not stuck on the broken bone; and for this purpose, so that you may see any disease each day, when the ligament is softened or sometimes the stick is already remolded, then you will correct it and strengthen the bandage.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And then place the patient's sleeper on their back, and place other cushions under them so that they sleep on a small cushion; because this will elevate the helper of theirs from the lap of that one, and therefore is elevated the fracture of the clavicle to elevation of the muscle; or rather, his arm is tied to his neck.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not untie the bandage unless it happens at the most urgent or near an artery, within twelve days.

De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	On the Restoration of Clavicle Fracture.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	A spoon should be broken at the side of it, not from it, only on its edges.

When the place of the body is broken — and it is broken in the middle place of the body — and nothing can be seen except by touch, then, according to how the figure of the fracture is forced, prepare the patient and reduce that according to the natural shape in every manner in which you can make it possible.

Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	On the Restoration of the Fracture of the Foot.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas. De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On the restoration of fracture of the vertebrae of the two and the neck.
