E majorment cove que tu fassas aquo en fractura, e quan am aquela es plagua propriament.	And more still is necessary to do this in fracture, and when I have applied it properly.
E aprop considera en quascun jorn la camba e studia am aquel per derier studi, e tu le guardes de apostema e de imflacio o de autres causas semblantz; e cum accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, lahoras opausa te a lu am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	And consider it every day the opening and study it with great care, and you guard it from apoplexy and inflammation or other causes similar; and whenever any of those occurs, then counteract it over it so that it may be cured.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	Fracture of the ankle and bones of the foot and toes.
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	At the ankle it does not occur fracture of all; but the bones of the foot sometimes occur fracture, and the toes of the foot rarely occur fracture, except in their natural position.
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant.	If the bones of the foot have a fracture and those bones are elevated above each other in them, then the patient places his foot on the earth prepared with an ant.
E aprop pausa la un pe sobre aquo que es elevat de aquels osses, e aprop calca aquels, e prem, e engualha aquels entro que torno en los locs.	And place another foot on that which is elevated by those bones, and press them together, pressing, and joining them in the place.
E aprop pausa emplastre e stopa desus, e pausa dejos le ventre del pe una petita taula a la qual sian dos caps plas.	And apply plaster and stop the above, and place behind the belly of the foot a small table to which are two flat caps.
E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	And stretch that limb of the foot with descending tension, as you have wrapped it with drapes and other covers of which you demanded.
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	And after they have passed three days or four, you remove the bandage, for you will find the bones joined, or broken, or dislocated, and the operation in those cases is so painful.
Mays si alcus ditz son trincatz, lahoras restaura aquels, e enguala aquels ayssi cum yeu e recomtat a tu en la restauracio dels ditz de la ma.	May he say that his joints are swollen, and as soon as the swelling has subsided, and it is equal to what you have seen before, restore them thus as I told you in the restoration of the disease of the hand.
E aprop pausa al dit trincat stela segon la longitut del dit, e sia pus lada de lu un pauc; e aprop dejos le pe aquesta taula la qual e a tu recomtada, e strenh aquela am strictura decent.	And place the swollen joint on the same line as the length of the finger, and let it be slightly tighter than before; and put down that table which I have recommended to you, and strengthen the surrounding structure firmly.
Mays si aquo que es trincat dels osses so dos o tres o mays, lahoras tu pausa sobre quascun dit astela de la sua quantitat envolopada en drap leon, e strenh la taula en le pus bas del pe, e sia stant sobre la un dels caps de la taula foro le ventre del pe per que la tengua am bona retencio.	May it be that the joint of the bone is two or three or more, and therefore you place a cloth around the digit to cover its quantity wrapped in linen, and strengthen the table at the base of the foot, standing on one of the table's ends over the belly of the foot so that it holds good retention.
E es convenient a tu que no oblides que no consideres totas las causas las quals que e ditas a tu en las autras fracturas dels accidentz que havem dit; e opausa te a tot accident am aquo que cove.	And it is to your advantage that you not forget, and do not consider all the causes which I have told you in other broken accidents; and oppose yourself to every such accident here that occurs.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	On the fracture of the neck of the woman and the bone of the little finger, and the injury of the man's groin.
Quan le conh de la femna es trincat, lahoras fay aquela ceser en cezela cayrada, e aprop enclina aquela a la partida del dos un petit, e sia tenguda detras.	When the pain of the female is caught, then break that caesure in the cartilaginous area, and place it backwards into the joint at the bend of the elbow.
E aprop la matrona umpla le conh de coto, e sia fayt en le conh de lu ayssi cum spera; e aprop la femna sia concutida, e eleva le dos de lu petit a petit, quar tot aquo es fora-getat entro que sia denant la partida del conh ayssi cum spera e l’os trincat retorna.	And then place the matron's (midwife's) hand on the back of the child, in the same way as a spear; and then the woman should be turned, elevating her knees little by little, so that all is forgotten until it appears before the child as before, and the bone returns.
E aprop pausa pulvils sobre le dos de lu, e quan vol urinar remaugua le coto am facilitat e aprop urine, e reduzeys e retorna aquel segon la manieyra segon la qual mezist aquel al comensament, e aprop retorne al sieu pulvil primier.	And then place powder on her back; and when she wants to urinate, raise her knee with ease and draw out the urine, and return it again according to the manner in which she mixed it at the beginning, and return to her first powder.
E fassa ayssi per vii dias o enviro aquels, quar aquel es restaurat.	And for seven days or more around that time, because she is restored.
E si voles, pren una vezica de ovela e strenh sobre le trauc de lu una canula de canavera; e entromet tota la vesica en le conh de lu, e aprop ensuffla en la canula am vertut entro que la vesica sia imflada dedintz le conh, quar la fractura retorna.	And if you wish, take an udder and stretch over the neck of it a cannula of flax; and introduce all the bladder into the child's joint, and then inhale through the cannula with virtue until the bladder is inflated from inside to outside, so that the fracture returns.
E aprop sia umplida de coto e estia per alcus dias segon que havem recomtat, entro que sia sanat.	It should be filled with powder and remain in place for several days according to what has been recorded, until it is healed.
E quan le os del pentenil de home o de femna es trincat, lahoras aministra en la restauracio e agulacio de lu aquo que havem recomtat en l’os del anca.	When the bone of the femoral neck in man or woman is fractured, it is customary to administer the treatment and suture of this according to what has been recorded in the bone of the hip.
E aquo que es dreyt no es occultat en aquestas fracturas proprinquas e que pauc endeveno, majorment ad aquel al qual es alcun studi e us e enten aquest meu libre mot; quar aquela fractura significa a tu en las majors disposicios via dreyturiera en la restauracio e en la strictura de lu, e donc enten be.	And what is true in these fractures does not remain hidden and can happen to most people, especially those who do not have study or understanding of this book; for that fracture means to you in the major dispositions via ductile strength in restoration and rigidity of it, therefore understand well.
Mays en la vergua del home quan es trincada, pren guarguamela de auca, e met la vergua en aquela; e aprop pausa sobre lu envolucio de drap, e sia envolopada, e aprop sia layssada per tres dias o enviro aquels, e sia sanada.	But in the thigh of man when it is fractured, take gall-nut oil and put the thigh into that; and place a pause over the wrapping of cloth, and cover it, and let it be laid for three days or near to those, and be healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	On the restoration of fracture of bones when it is swollen.
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit.	It is convenient for that one to whom the fracture occurs with swelling, and especially if the bone is large, like the bone of the thigh or of the adductor, or similar in shape, as you will see and flay open immediately if the conditions of flaying are the same as those who have previously said.
E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.	If the wound is well-healed, then cover that you have caught it to prevent it from becoming contaminated again, and do not powderize excessively on it if there is another cause.
E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.	Then begin to restore the fracture on that particular day, and do not prolong it unless there is an apoplexy.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.	But if the apoplexy is caught, then lay off the restoration of the fracture within three days, until the apoplexy has subsided, and do not approach it on the seventh day, lest you cause further misfortune.
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	But if the bone is severely fractured over the neck uncovered, then cover that you will perform to reduce it and enclose it with your hands gently and with a little extent.
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	But if the extent is not according to your preparation and the equation of it with your hands, then you will reduce it with your hands in this instrument; and it is an instrument made of iron, whose length is seven or eight digits, and its breadth corresponds to the quantity of the wound; and thus it is necessary for the doctor to take three or four of those according to the quantity you indicated here in all kinds of fractures.
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	The text means: And let it be returned, and return to its little roughness in order not to be folded over you must have comprehension about that man in the hour of operation.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	The text means: And is it an acute extremity to which there is an edge on its own extremities; and is the underpart of it swollen, and the majority coming into parts.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	The text means: And this is how it looks like:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	The text means: It is called in Greek "Labrys" (labre volentz), therefore it is small.
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	The text means: Why must the extremity of it be elevated above the prominence of the bone.
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	The text means: And it is inserted into a position inside where the bone returns, and is turned in such a way that there is no equation.
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	The text means: And therefore it is forced to turn the extremities of the fracture between them, and if the broken extremity is subtle, and does not take that support for good exception, then it must be possible that you insert the extremity of that bone into which the instrument has power there.
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	If you cannot reduce the bone of all this place that has been recorded, then encase it in that same place where you need to sew it up with the stitches which have been mentioned; or cut it in one of the ways in which it is possible.
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	And appropriate remove that which remains in the bone of roughness and small scratches.
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	And when the bone is reduced, and you properly place the reduction on the hernia, there is usually great pain felt by the patient, as soon as you see that the bone has not returned to its natural place; and then thus confer great relief.
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	When your restoration is complete which you perform on the bone, and afterwards submerge it in vinegar of white wine, and properly if it is in summer, and do not put pressure on the inflamed area or any other cause that is oily, so that it does not cause a putrefaction and corruption.
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	And appropriate administer stakes in the hour of your completion of the bone's restoration, and let the wound be uncovered, to that it may be cauterized with forceps and covered with bandages according to the quantity of the wound.
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	It is necessary to take great care not to strain the wound further with a fracture, for many times doctors have tried this and it has resulted in the patient's death or severe illness, so that is sickness.
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	If the twisted bone is looser than others, softer than the other fractures.
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	If the wound is large or a malignant plague and you fear about those accidental blows that you had recommended to them, and there's great pain in the location, then do not press on those stakes, but instead wrap them with hard drapes in place of stakes and tightly bind them.
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	When another day or two have passed and the wound begins to come out again, take off the bandage on which you had placed it earlier, and apply calomel, a quinine-like medicine, just as we do for other wounds, somewhat similar to it.
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	It is advisable to dissect the ligament and consider the wound in such a way that it may be dead by morning and night, until it becomes consolidated and fixed, and the member is prepared in such a manner that the suppuration can flow from it to the parts left behind with ease.
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	If the plague passes for many days and it is not consolidated or cut off from its limb, then you know that these are signs of smallpox because you will want to investigate the plague with a poultice.
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	And of those signs, some are separated away and removed, those that cannot be separated from them, put the limb back and cause it to have pain, therefore consider them according to what is possible for you.
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	If it happens to the plague that it is pus or ulcers, then this is sthenic or another type of corruption and putrefaction, therefore cover so long as one of those has it in place, because from their remedy is preceded narrative in its capital.
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o xxx; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	And from that point where you cover the place so that it is hot, when you see that the swelling has gone, be careful not to scratch or cut it, for fear of attraction or extraction since many times it has caused death through this; handle it lightly until it heals, for if it's light it will recover in about 20 days or 30.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.1.
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	The meaning of this line is: 'Of the treatment for a knot that occurs in the remains of any fracture.'
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	The meaning of this line is: 'Invisible signs occur in the vestige of fracture treatment, and more frequently in joints, and the figure of the limb; and for that reason severely restricts the limb from its normal operation.'
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	The meaning of this line is: 'Therefore, consider if the knot is recent and treat it with medicines that have been applied to such a condition elsewhere, examine, search, prick, scratch, and test whether those belong to it; take some of these or all of them, and apply them in a paste, and bind those on top of the knot in order.'
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	The meaning of this line is: 'Let the stricture not be loosened for more than a few days; and if necessary, loosen it and try another, until the knot is resolved; or tie tightly to that lamina of lead which has the property of dissolving all that is inflated in the limbs.'
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	The meaning of this line is: 'But if the knot has already become calcified and tightness is required to provoke an opening, then loosen it in that most superior part of it, and insert that surplus or residue into something receptive, or ratz it with a resorcin or calamine until it is resolved; and cure it until it is healed.'
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	Restoration of fracture when it is restored and this is left to remain in its natural state.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a fracture of bone is restored, and this is left to remain in its natural state, it is nonetheless done so for various causes: because of excessive solution of the ligament and its binding not according to what is proper; or due to superfluous stricture of the ligaments within which nourishment cannot be carried to the member; or because of excessive bleeding from over-treatment; or because of excessive movement that does not occur at the proper time; or because of scarcity of medicine in the body and because of weakness of it.
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	And cure for this is to decrease the disease in the patient and make the heart of him soft within what the medicine is multiplied in him; and to give him food; and to insert gauge and letality over him.
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	And place the poultice on the member to prevent it from attracting more nourishment; or continue the bleeding of him with water tea, until nourishment flows and returns to its original figure.
Capitol .xxii.	The title of the book is Chapter 22.
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	On the treatment of bent bones that need to be restored and for which surgery is forbidden from now on.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When an affected member is restored to health and the bone becomes bent again and swollen with nodules, but the member is not completely cured of its original deformity, and therefore it is forbidden from undergoing a more radical surgical operation, because if you receive the word of one who has never experienced such a severely bent limb.
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	But this has already been done by some foolish doctors and restorers who have performed this operation in our land, and this procedure is utterly reprehensible, because the sign of which is death.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	But if claudication and nodules are recent, it is allowed to be encased in a water-soaked cloth containing herbs that soften the coots, like those used for making shoes of high quality and with soft leather; or made with a mucilage similar to that done with quillon (I don't know what "ben fayt" means, but I'll leave it as is); or covered with a layer of plaster soaked in gray gauline oil or camphor oil; with the added figs fatty and trampled on the buttocks of a pigeon, and similar to those medicinals known as Armerian consolidation.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	The text means: And some warts are dissolved by persistent friction that they may be on the most moist parts, and are administered movement of the member throughout all parts in all hours.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	The text means: But if the tortuosity has come back and is made strong and it has been converted into a thorn and it causes the need for its cure with iron, then cover that which is above so that it does not fall again, and dissolve until the continuity of the bone is finished, and insert those subtleties of metal where there are nodes on the bones, and provide ease to that which requires it and study.
Capitol .xxiii.	The text means: Chapter XXIII.
De sermo en dislocacio.	The text means: On the treatment of dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	The text means: Dislocation is necessarily of one of the joints of the patient's body, therefore it must be prohibited from movement, and the figure of the member is reduced, and brings pain to the patient and large lesions.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	The text means: Therefore when such an accident occurs, cover as soon as possible that it may be reduced, and do not delay reducing it, because if it is delayed, the spot becomes inflamed and strong with this, and it makes difficult the reduction of the dislocation.

De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	Treatment of joint dislocation.

De curacio de anca dislocada.	Of treatment for a dislocated ankle.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the ankle and the joint of the muscle do not suffer only dislocation, but also accidents at those places as they happen to other joints with slight movement and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	The joint of the pelvis is displaced in four ways: it is displaced at the partitions of the abdomen, or externally, or internally, or behind.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	It is more frequently displaced internally or behind, and less often externally.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui. E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	The site where such displacement occurs is externally, because the accidents are contrary to this one.

E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	When a dislocation occurs at the joints behind, that person does not expand the joint, nor can he or she bend it in front of doubling it up, and the cushion under him is shorter than the other one, and the joint is softened, and the head of the hernia is located where the location is.

The reduction of this type of dislocation is that you consider it, because if the dislocation is old and ancient, then it has already been in place for a long time, so therefore you will administer a reduction to it, but still follow its disposition, because it's not a cure-all; and thus it cannot be done without some prognosis.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	But if it is in someone with recent dislocation and one of the four types of dislocations, then you note that you should return to that joint and extend it to both parts inside and outside, and make it on both sides, right or left, as soon as possible, without needing any other treatment.

The text states: The length of the intestine or hernia extends from where it is inserted into the anus to where it protrudes at the opening of the pubic bone or behind the pubic bone.

Therefore if the dislocation returns to the point we have discussed, it is good; otherwise, it is necessary to consider all that has been said about its own cure.

If you have seen any cause of softening, then surely your return to the form and placement of that one, and extension of it according to your first structure, let it be so in three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And let it be so that he is released from that, and let him walk on some ground for a certain number of days, until he becomes comfortable.

De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the cure of dislocation of the knee.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The knee is dislocated in three manners: it is displaced outwardly, inwardly, and more so downward towards the back, and not at all forward.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of knee dislocation is that you command the patient to apply his cushion in the space; then surely, the knee is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	The translated sentence is:
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Place that part over the cavity, and fasten the cushion to it, and bind those parts with a band for three days or four, and untie them.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	Do not use the stretcher for transport for more than two days, until the patient is cured and comforted.

Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	On the treatment of the displacement of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle sometimes is reduced by small movement, and sometimes is displaced according to the complement, and the displacement of it is done on the joint parts inside or outside.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of the ankle displacement is that when the ankle swells before the joint to which it is displaced.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	But the treatment of the reduction of it is of slight retraction, and so that it be extended with facility to the muscles and be drawn in until it returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	When the cure of him is performed according to proper form, cover that wound tightly, and keep it securely under his armpits at its middle position.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And take both your right hand to the highest part of the foot and hold your left hand on the lesser part of the foot at the cleft.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And pull the foot with your right hand, and hold it with your left hand twice, and extend the left arm; and push the foot's heel down by the cushion so that it works.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do this twice as many times as have been counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And push the foot's heel down to the last cushion, and you are at the cleft.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Therefore if you return to the same method once or twice, and if several times push the foot inwards, it is good; but otherwise over him it iterates the operation, because he returns.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	Unless it is forbidden to you to reduce the wound at this point where many have recounted, then hold the patient on his back over the earth, and lay a wooden splint on firm ground, and that case between the thighs of him, and you already have covered him with a sheet so that he does not fall.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And now that the doctor has taken his patient's body parts, and another servant stretches out his arm on top of him or over his thigh that lies on the chest of the pain; and another servant extends anyone to the extent of their back, and the pillow shall be placed between the patient's thighs, retaining those parts so that the shape of his body is not pulled in those parts from which the disease extends.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And the doctor brings the dislocation back to its place with his hands, and another servant holds the healthy cavity in those parts, because the dislocation returns to ease.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And therefore when the dislocation returns and it is declared that there is health in the reduction of him, then pause in the plastering and extend with a strong bandage, and tie his foot to the cushion.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And it is advisable to beware of the nerves that are behind on the heel, lest the bandage over those be too tight and hurt them.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And lightly bind him for two days or three; and if the bandage is softened, remove it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	Take out the affected area on the fourth day or the eighth day, and prohibit the illness from rising for forty days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if it is forced to go into that space, there is no safe guarantee that the dislocation will not be dissolved and corrupted, so this should not be done.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if it happens to the artery that is cauterized, then cover it so that you administer in the contraction of this place where our narrative began, in another place of healing and embolization, until it is mended.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter XXXIV.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On the Cure of Dislocation of the Toes of the Foot.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	So that the one who is dislocated be reduced with a little extension of work; and this if not easy, it is lighter.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in the two great toenails of the foot, then cover that the wound is made on the patient's foot over a bed of earth or on a table, and it should be so situated as if he were walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	You should stand still and place your foot on that which you suspect is near the joints, and press down firmly upon it with your foot until it returns, and so that you do not see it again in that elevated location.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	Next, place the belly of the foot on a table that takes up the entire foot, which has two handles, and press down firmly upon that structure with your strength for three days; and then remove it and let it rest in walking position for another three days, until it is stretched out and secure.

De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the various kinds of dislocation that are caused by a wound or by a fracture or by any sort of injury.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any of these happen and you puncture yourself in the wound's cure and in its restoration many times it succeeds but sometimes death occurs.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And therefore it is not wise to presume on the cure of him unless he who is skilled in the art, of long use, mercy and piety, acts with caution, without rashness or presumption; and when beginning medical treatments that cut away only so much, he should judge whether the patient will recover from death, from illness, nor find any hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And then there will be an effort to make it as much as possible at the beginning of the cause, before you try to find an apothecary caut.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then if the member returns according to what you wish, then as soon as possible administer the regimen which will provide apothecary caut and cure the plague with that which is convenient for him of the dry cough.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if there is dislocation and fracture and the bone separates into two pieces, then you will perform the statement of their position, and do in that so that what has been said in the simple illnesses of this kind is preceded in the places of those.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And guard and avoid according to your judgment that which is in the instruments on the paths of fear as it is preceded by my prediction; for this is more good to you than if it were yours, and more lasting to your glory, and more blessings to your true face in your time.
